{
    "name": "Petrov Type D spacetime metric",
    "abbrev": "PetrovTypeDMetric",
    "description": "A type of spacetime metric with a complex algebraic structure, characterized by the presence of a singularity and a horizon. This metric is used to describe the spacetime around a rotating black hole.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": false,
    "signature": 0,
    "dimensions": 4,

    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "KerrChart",
            "xlineElement": "-dt^2+(1-2M/r+Q^2/r^2)*dr^2+(r^2+Q^2)*dθ^2+(r^2sin^2θ)*dφ^2",
            "validated": false,
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": ["christoffels", "ricci", "riemann", "einstein", "weyl", "g00", "infiniteRedShift", "horizons", "singularities", "limits"],
    "diagrams": []
}[0m
